ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Reset model parameter values after a fit

DESC.PARA: The reset command restores the parameter values after fitting to the default value set by "guess" or to the user-defined default. The get_model command may be used as the argument instead of explicitly listing the current source model.

LIST.ITEM: model - the model component or expression to reset

DESC.PARA: If the user set initial model values or soft limits - e.g. either with the "set_par" command or by turning on parameter prompting ("ahelp paramprompt") - reset will restore these values and limits even after the guess command has been used or a fit was done.
Set a source model, fit the data, then reset the model parameters to the pre-fit values.
Set a complex source model, fit the data, then reset one of the model components to the pre-fit values.
The get_model command is used as the argument to reset.

BUGS.PARA: See the bugs pages on the Sherpa website for an up-to-date listing of known bugs.
